availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Married to Mary A. K. Colvin Applegate on November 10, 1841. Father of William H. Applegate, John B. Applegate, John B. Applegate, Mary N. Applegate, Lucius A. Apllegate, James B. Applegate, Leslie F. Appleton, and Judith E. Appleton.

Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in Captain M. Mullins Company, Police Guard Kentucky Central Railroad as Second Lieutenant from October 18, 1861 to November 11, 1861. Served in the 18th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Second Lieutenant, First Lieutenant from October 13, 1861 to December 27, 1862.
